title: Hello world!
content: Yesterday evening I saw a commercial for a web hosting provider and, for a moment, I wondered whether I really needed a website. Of course, the honest answer is: no one needs a personal website. But something in me kept nudging: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve wanted to share what you‚Äôre learning for a long time. Maybe it‚Äôs finally time.‚Äù I knew I could use Github Pages to host a static website for free and wanted to try that for a while anyway. So‚Ä¶ here we are.  I‚Äôm a curious person by nature‚Äîprobably to a fault‚Äîand over the years I‚Äôve collected little pockets of knowledge from many corners: programming, data science, the energy domain, process modelling, investing in the stock market, philosophy, the way we learn, and, naturally, the truly important things in life‚Äîlike cats or baking delicious Vanillekipferl.  This website will be my digital home base. A place where I can share what I‚Äôm working on, explain things I‚Äôve learned, document confusing-but-interesting rabbit holes, and maybe even write about ideas that are still half-formed. I have a lot of interests but tend to forget about things again from time to time, so this place here might help me keep track of some things.  To start, you‚Äôll see posts related to my master‚Äôs thesis: background on the austrian energy market, technical details, and some things I wish someone had told me earlier. But over time, I hope this little space grows into a broader reflection of who I am. I want to use it as a place where I can share chunks of knowledge.  Let‚Äôs see where this goes.
